Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate and label two different habitats, one land-based and one water-based, in their drawing.
The student can clearly depict and label a variety of living things in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or animals like lizards and squirrels.
The student can clearly depict and label a variety of living things in the water habitat, such as fish, clams, and aquatic plants.
The student can show differences in the types of living things between the two habitats by comparing the number and types depicted in each.
The student can use their drawing to explain patterns of plant and animal diversity observed in both habitats.
